alert.note: Alert for Clark; Greene (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 04 at 2:45PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF CLARK AND GREENE COUNTIES THROUGH 330 PM EDT... At 244 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located near Xenia, moving north at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph, frequent cloud-to-ground lightning, and very heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Lightning can cause serious injury or death. Visibility will be poor and hydroplaning is possible. Locations impacted include... Springfield, Beavercreek, Huber Heights, Fairborn, Xenia, New Carlisle, Yellow Springs, Wright-Patterson Afb, Northridge, Cedarville, Enon, Jamestown, South Charleston, Wilberforce, Harmony, Lisbon, New Jasper, North Hampton, South Vienna and Tremont City. This includes I-70 in Ohio between mile markers 41 and 67. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. Motorists should slow down and use extra caution. When thunder roars, go indoors! Do not stay in the open or seek shelter under trees when lightning threatens. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
